main event: A round object the size of a basketball was observed in the sky over Hollis, Long Island, New York on September 19, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed at a 45 degree angle, moving at a constant speed towards the horizon.
The witness commented that the object's unusual speed was probably due to the winds, and it was likely a balloon.
The report concluded that the object was probably a balloon.
A sketch of the sighting is included in the report.
sighted object: round object the size of a basketball
photographs: no, but a sketch is included
